# isPausable

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is tracking work that you can pause.

## Declaration

```swift
var isPausable: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

By default, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress] objects aren’t pausable.

You typically use this property to communicate whether controls for pausing appear in a progress-reporting user interface. [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress] itself doesn’t do anything with this property other than help pass the value from progress reporters to progress observers.

If an `NSProgress` is pausable, implement the ability to pause either by setting a block for the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/pausingHandler] property, or by polling the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isPaused] property periodically while performing the relevant work.

It’s valid for the value of this property to change during the lifetime of an `NSProgress` object. By default, `NSProgress` is KVO-compliant for this property. It sends notifications on the same thread that updates the property.

## Reporting Progress

- **totalUnitCount**: The total number of tracked units of work for the current progress.
- **completedUnitCount**: The number of completed units of work for the current job.
- **localizedDescription**: A localized description of tracked progress for the receiver.
- **localizedAdditionalDescription**: A more specific localized description of tracked progress for the receiver.
- **isCancellable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is tracking work that you can cancel.
- **isCancelled**: A Boolean value that Indicates whether the receiver is tracking canceled work.
- **cancellationHandler**: The block to invoke when canceling progress.
- **isPaused**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is tracking paused work.
- **pausingHandler**: The block to invoke when pausing progress.
